Articles.Content:
Fairings are useful, you could build pretty much any shape you want, like domes or command capsules. But I face a problem when trying to build manned fairing vessels. 

1. the only part that looks like an airlock is the mk1 lander can, which means clipping into the main command modules, which leads to some terrifying IVA boxes.

2. Even mk1 lander can isn't a fully usable airlock, sometimes the only way to EVA outside requires offsetting the lander can more than half of the lander can's radius, which isn't very streamlined.

3. I asked the discord about the fairing bugs and one says that the fairing sometimes doesn't have a hitbox (except the fairing base), which sometimes prohibits the Kerbal ability to EVA inside the fairing ( for domes).

So with the next update coming soon,  pls maybe do some tweaking on the fairing or add an airlock.

7 hours ago, Sirius K said:

solid hitbox

The fairings that close to a point have a solid collider.  Fairings that close on another part have a hollow collider.

You can enable the 'interstage nodes' on the fairing base, attach a nose-cone to one of the resulting green nodes, and then close the fairing on that nose-cone.

I wasn't sure, so I just tired it.   Just closing on a part also gives a hollow collider.
